This is Brad Harper again and I just wanted to touch base with everyone as we begin week 2 of conditioning for our student-athletes of Virginia HS and Virginia MS. There will some slight adjustments to our schedule this week and moving forward. To protect everyone involved we will close the track and infield area to everyone NOT participating in workouts from 7:30am-11:00am on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday each week, until further notice.

Workout times will now be 7th-9th graders from 8am-9am (check in begins at 7:45am) and 10th-12th graders from 9:30am-10:45am (check in begins at 9:15am)

We will continue health screenings questions, temperature checks, and everyone must have a mask, current VHSL physical, and their own water. We will continue to practice social distancing precautions. Remember these workouts are for any VMS or VHS student and are non-sport specific in nature. Thanks to everyone for their support and understanding and Go Bearcats!!

GIRLS: Virginia High 54, Eastside 43

Maria Wilson scored 24 points as the Virginia High Bearcats ran past Eastside in the first round of the Ballard Lee Bearcat Tip-Off Classic.

The Bearcats closed the first half on a 16-5 run to take control in their first game of the 2019-20 season.

Kaylee Yates led Eastside with 14 points.

BOYS: Virginia High 71, Chilhowie 47

Gavin Austin scored 17 points as Virginia High opened the season with a victory in the Ballard Lee Bearcat Tip-Off Classic.

Tyler Strong’s 11 points and Jon Clifton’s 10 points also keyed the win for the Bearcats, who had nine different players reach the scoring column. VHS outscored the Warriors 20-7 in the second quarter to take control.

Chilhowie was led by Ray Berry’s 10 points.

Attention All Bearcat Fans:

Just a reminder that tomorrow, Thursday, Sept 12th Virginia HS will host V-T Spirit Night and Meet The Bearcats! The event will start at 5pm in the track parking lot with free inflatables, face painting, and games for kids of all ages. We will also have food trucks, Kona Ice, and Sunset Slush selling their respective items. Bearcat Merchandise will be available for purchase.

At approximately 7:45pm we will move to the main gym of VHS for Meet The Bearcats. This will include all of the following teams and organizations:

Jr.Bearcats football players and cheerleaders
MS Sports- Volleyball, Football, Cheer, and Cross Country
HS Sports and Activities- Volleyball, Golf, Cross Country, Cheer, Football, and Band

After all teams are introduced (approximately 9pm) there will be a bonfire to conclude spirit night in the grassy area of VHS near the church. Please make plans to attend for an evening of fun and fellowship. This is a great opportunity to get to know your 2019 fall season Bearcats.

AUGUST 30 - LOCATION CHANGE FOR VHS FOOTBALL GAME

The football game between Virginia HS and Tazewell will now be played at 7pm on Friday, August 30th at Fred Selfe Stadium on the campus of Emory & Henry College. This location change is due to the Bristol Pirates qualifying for the playoffs and having a home game on Friday night.

Gates at Fred Selfe Stadium will open at 5:45pm. A fan bus is available at no charge and will leave the front parking lot of VHS at 6:00 p.m.

Tickets will be $6.00! BVPS ID’s, Bearcat Football, Bearcat All-Sports Passes, and all state approved passes will be accepted.

Also, there will be no Bearcat Bandwagon as previously scheduled at Van Pelt. This event will be combined with Highland View on October 25th.

Go Bearcats!

Brad Harper

Bristol Virginia Public Schools Education Foundation is with Donna Hale and 4 others.
May 23, 2019 at 9:32 PM ·

Today, we awarded mini-grants to teachers in the Bristol Virginia Public Schools. Because of our community's investment in the BVPS Education Foundation through giving and fundraising events, our board had the pleasure of adding an additional $1,000 grant this year for a total of THREE $1,000 grants! ❤️

We think it's a pretty great way to end the school year!

This morning, Donna Hale, president of the BVPS Education Foundation, announced our 2019 Creative Classroom Mini-Grant winners:

✅ Dana Rasnick at Van Pelt Elementary School for "Incorporating Exciting Technology into Classroom Literacy Stations."

✅ Brittany Minnick at Van Pelt Elementary School for "Early Childhood Special Education Playground. "

✅ Donna Mumpower and Kathleen Tabor at Virginia Middle School for "Creative Arts Studio Workshop."

Congratulations, winners!

We are so thankful to all the amazing teachers who submitted applications this year, and we wish our panel could have awarded all of you. Thank you for going above and beyond to offer interactive, creative learning opportunities for our students.
